values.name: gauss
values.description: Gaussian weighted resampling - applies a gaussian weighting to contributing pixels

values.name: rms

get.description: Generate values and color swatches mapping for a given interval classmap.

parameters.name: classmapName
parameters.description: classmap name

parameters.name: trim_start
parameters.description: Number of items to trim from the start of the cmap

parameters.name: trim_end
parameters.description: Number of items to trim from the end of the cmap

200.description:
Interval legend response model.

Represents a color map for intervals, where each interval is defined by:
- A numeric range `[min, max]` representing the interval boundaries.
- An RGBA color `[red, green, blue, alpha]` associated with the interval.

The response is a 2D array of interval definitions, where each element is a pair:
- The first element is an array of two numbers `[min, max]` defining the interval.
- The second element is an array of four numbers `[red, green, blue, alpha]` defining the RGBA color.

Example:
```json
[
  [
    [-2, 0], [0, 0, 0, 0]
  ],
  [
    [1, 32], [255, 255, 178, 255]
  ]
]
```
This example defines two intervals:
- The interval `[-2, 0]` is mapped to the color `[0, 0, 0, 0]` (transparent black).
- The interval `[1, 32]` is mapped to the color `[255, 255, 178, 255]` (opaque yellow).

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

parameters.name: buffer
parameters.description:
Buffer on each side of the given tile. It must be a multiple of `0.5`. Output
**tilesize** will be expanded to `tilesize + 2 * buffer` (e.g 0.5 = 257x257,
1.0 = 258x258).

parameters.name: color_formula
parameters.description: rio-color formula (info: https://github.com/mapbox/rio-color)

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: STAC Collection ID

parameters.name: resampling
parameters.description: Resampling method

values.name: nearest
values.description: Nearest neighbor - fastest method that selects the closest pixel value

values.name: bilinear
values.description: Bilinear interpolation - calculates output values using a weighted average of 2x2 input cells

values.name: cubic
values.description: Cubic interpolation - uses a weighted average of 4x4 input cells for smoother results

values.name: cubic_spline
values.description: Cubic spline interpolation - similar to cubic but preserves edges better

values.name: lanczos
values.description: Lanczos windowed sinc resampling - high-quality with minimal artifacts

values.name: average
values.description: Average resampling - calculates the mean of all contributing pixels

values.name: mode
values.description: Mode resampling - selects the most common value from contributing pixels

values.name: gauss
values.description: Gaussian weighted resampling - applies a gaussian weighting to contributing pixels

values.name: rms
values.description: Root mean square resampling - useful for resampling error or deviation grids

parameters.name: pixel_selection
parameters.description: Pixel selection method.

values.name: first
values.description: Select pixel from the first available image

values.name: highest
values.description: Select pixel with the highest value

values.name: lowest
values.description: Select pixel with the lowest value

values.name: mean
values.description: Calculate mean of available pixels

values.name: median
values.description: Calculate median of available pixels

values.name: standardDeviation
values.description: Calculate standard deviation of available pixels

values.name: lastBandLow
values.description: Select image with lowest value in the last band

values.name: lastBandHigh
values.description: Select image with highest value in the last band

parameters.name: algorithm
parameters.description: Terrain algorithm name

values.name: hillshade
values.description: Creates hillshade visualization from elevation data

values.name: contours
values.description: Generates elevation contour lines

values.name: normalizedIndex
values.description: Calculates normalized difference index between bands

values.name: terrarium
values.description: Encodes elevation data in Mapbox Terrarium RGB format

values.name: terrainrgb
values.description: Encodes elevation data in Mapbox TerrainRGB format

parameters.name: algorithm_params
parameters.description: Terrain algorithm parameters

parameters.name: rescale
parameters.description: comma (',') delimited Min,Max range. Can set multiple time for multiple bands.

get.description:
Fetch features of the feature collection with id `collectionId`.

Every feature in a dataset belongs to a collection. A dataset may
consist of multiple feature collections. A feature collection is often a
collection of features of a similar type, based on a common schema.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The optional limit parameter recommends the number of items that should be present in the response document.

If the limit parameter value is greater than advertised limit maximum, the server must return the
maximum possible number of items, rather than responding with an error.

Only items are counted that are on the first level of the collection in the response document.
Nested objects contained within the explicitly requested items must not be counted.

Minimum = 1. Maximum = 10000. Default = 10.

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description:
Only features that have a geometry that intersects the bounding box are selected.
The bounding box is provided as four or six numbers, depending on whether the
coordinate reference system includes a vertical axis (height or depth):

- Lower left corner, coordinate axis 1
- Lower left corner, coordinate axis 2
- Minimum value, coordinate axis 3 (optional)
- Upper right corner, coordinate axis 1
- Upper right corner, coordinate axis 2
- Maximum value, coordinate axis 3 (optional)

The coordinate reference system of the values is WGS 84 longitude/latitude
(http://www.opengis.net/def/crs/OGC/1.3/CRS84).

For WGS 84 longitude/latitude the values are in most cases the sequence of
minimum longitude, minimum latitude, maximum longitude and maximum latitude.
However, in cases where the box spans the antimeridian the first value
(west-most box edge) is larger than the third value (east-most box edge).

If the vertical axis is included, the third and the sixth number are
the bottom and the top of the 3-dimensional bounding box.

If a feature has multiple spatial geometry properties, it is the decision of the
server whether only a single spatial geometry property is used to determine
the extent or all relevant geometries.

parameters.name: datetime
parameters.description:
Either a date-time or an interval, open or closed. Date and time expressions
adhere to RFC 3339. Open intervals are expressed using double-dots.

Examples:

- A date-time: "2018-02-12T23:20:50Z"
- A closed interval: "2018-02-12T00:00:00Z/2018-03-18T12:31:12Z"
- Open intervals: "2018-02-12T00:00:00Z/.." or "../2018-03-18T12:31:12Z"

Only features that have a temporal property that intersects the value of
`datetime` are selected.

If a feature has multiple temporal properties, it is the decision of the
server whether only a single temporal property is used to determine
the extent or all relevant temporal properties.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description: Create a new STAC item or a set of items in a collection

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
STAC Item or StacItemCollection

Represents a STAC Item or StacItemCollection as defined by the STAC 1.0.0 standard.

**Item**: A GeoJSON Feature that represents a single spatiotemporal asset.
It includes metadata such as geometry, datetime, and links to related assets.
Example: A satellite image with its metadata.

**StacItemCollection**: A GeoJSON FeatureCollection that contains multiple Items.
It is used to group multiple related Items together, such as a collection of satellite images.

This union allows the request body to accept either a single Item or a collection of Items.

FilterLanguage.description:
Choices for filter-lang value in a POST request.

Based on
https://github.com/stac-api-extensions/filter#queryables

Note the addition of cql2-json, which is used by the pgstac backend,
but is not included in the spec above.

Defines the supported filter languages for STAC API queries.

values.name: cql-json
values.description: Common Query Language in JSON format.

values.name: cql2-json
values.description: Common Query Language 2 in JSON format

values.name: cql2-text
values.description: Common Query Language 2 in text format.

Geometry.description:
Represents a GeoJSON geometry object as defined by RFC 7946.

Supported geometry types include:
- **Point**: A single geographic coordinate.
- **LineString**: A sequence of geographic coordinates forming a line.
- **Polygon**: A closed shape defined by linear rings.
- **MultiPoint**: A collection of Points.
- **MultiLineString**: A collection of LineStrings.
- **MultiPolygon**: A collection of Polygons.

Used for spatial filtering in STAC.

bbox.description: Optional bounding box of the geometry.

body.description: The image data in JP2 format.
The image data in JPEG format.
The image data in JPG format.

rows.description: Height of the output image in pixels

showBranding.description: Whether to include branding on the output image

body.description: The image data in PNG format.
The image data in TIFF format.
The image data in WebP format.

RenderOption.description: Defines visualization parameters for rendering data on a map.

id.description: Unique identifier for the render option.

name.description: Short descriptive name for the render option.

description.description:
A longer description of the render option that can be used to explain its
content.

type.description: The type of rendering to apply (raster or vector).

values.name: raster-tile
values.description: Raster tile rendering type.

values.name: vt-polygon
values.description: Vector tile polygon rendering type.

values.name: vt-line
values.description: Vector tile line rendering type.

options.description:
A URL query-string encoded string of TiTiler rendering options. Valid only for `raster-tile` types.

See [Query Parameters](https://developmentseed.org/titiler/endpoints/cog/#description).

vectorOptions.description:
Options for rendering vector tiles. Valid only for `vt-polygon`  and `vt-line`
types.

minZoom.description: Minimum zoom level at which to display this layer.

legend.description: Legend configuration for this render option.

conditions.description:
A list of property/value conditions that must be in the active mosaic CQL for
this render option to be enabled

RenderOptionCondition.description: Defines a condition for enabling a render option.

property.description: Property name to check in the active CQL filter.

value.description: Value that the property must equal.

RenderOptionLegend.description: Configuration for generating a data legend.

type.description:
Legend type to make,
one of: `continuous`,
`classmap`,
`interval` or `none`
(note, `none` is a string literal).

labels.description: Text labels to display on the legend.

trimStart.description:
The number of items to trim from the start of the legend definition. Used if
there are values important for rendering (e.g. nodata) that aren't desirable in
the legend.

values.name: nearest

values.name: bilinear

values.name: cubic

values.name: cubic_spline

values.name: lanczos

values.name: average
values.description: Average resampling - calculates the mean of all contributing pixels

values.name: mode
values.description: Mode resampling - selects the most common value from contributing pixels

values.name: gauss
values.description: Gaussian weighted resampling - applies a gaussian weighting to contributing pixels

values.name: rms
values.description: Root mean square resampling - useful for resampling error or deviation grids

Tile Matrix Definition

A tile matrix, usually corresponding to a particular zoom level of a
TileMatrixSet.

MiscTileQueryParameters.rescale.name: rescale
MiscTileQueryParameters.rescale.description: comma (',') delimited Min,Max range. Can set multiple time for multiple bands.

MiscTileQueryParameters.returnMask.name: return_mask
MiscTileQueryParameters.returnMask.description: Add mask to the output data.

MosaicSearchQueryParameters.exitWhenFull.name: exitwhenfull
MosaicSearchQueryParameters.exitWhenFull.description: Return as soon as the geometry is fully covered (defaults to True in PgSTAC).

MosaicSearchQueryParameters.itemsLimit.name: items_limit
MosaicSearchQueryParameters.itemsLimit.description: Return as soon as we have N items per geometry (defaults to 100 in PgSTAC).

MosaicSearchQueryParameters.scanLimit.name: scan_limit
MosaicSearchQueryParameters.scanLimit.description: Return as soon as we scan N items (defaults to 10000 in PgSTAC).

MosaicSearchQueryParameters.skipCovered.name: skipcovered
MosaicSearchQueryParameters.skipCovered.description:
Skip any items that would show up completely under the previous items (defaults
to True in PgSTAC).

MosaicSearchQueryParameters.timeLimit.name: time_limit
MosaicSearchQueryParameters.timeLimit.description: Return after N seconds to avoid long requests (defaults to 5 in PgSTAC).

MosaicTileQueryParameters.buffer.name: buffer
MosaicTileQueryParameters.buffer.description:
Buffer on each side of the given tile. It must be a multiple of `0.5`. Output
**tilesize** will be expanded to `tilesize + 2 * buffer` (e.g 0.5 = 257x257,
1.0 = 258x258).

values.name: first
values.description: Select pixel from the first available image

values.name: highest
values.description: Select pixel with the highest value

values.name: lowest
values.description: Select pixel with the lowest value

values.name: mean
values.description: Calculate mean of available pixels

values.name: median
values.description: Calculate median of available pixels

values.name: standardDeviation
values.description: Calculate standard deviation of available pixels

values.name: lastBandLow
values.description: Select image with lowest value in the last band

values.name: lastBandHigh
values.description: Select image with highest value in the last band

values.name: nearest
values.description: Nearest neighbor - fastest method that selects the closest pixel value

values.name: bilinear
values.description: Bilinear interpolation - calculates output values using a weighted average of 2x2 input cells

values.name: cubic
values.description: Cubic interpolation - uses a weighted average of 4x4 input cells for smoother results

values.name: cubic_spline
values.description: Cubic spline interpolation - similar to cubic but preserves edges better

values.name: lanczos
values.description: Lanczos windowed sinc resampling - high-quality with minimal artifacts

values.name: average
values.description: Average resampling - calculates the mean of all contributing pixels

values.name: mode
values.description: Mode resampling - selects the most common value from contributing pixels

values.name: gauss
values.description: Gaussian weighted resampling - applies a gaussian weighting to contributing pixels

values.name: rms
values.description: Root mean square resampling - useful for resampling error or deviation grids

OdataQuery.skip.name: $skip
OdataQuery.skip.description: The number of items to skip

OdataQuery.top.name: $top
OdataQuery.top.description: The number of items to return

StatisticsQueryParameters.categoriesPixe.name: c
StatisticsQueryParameters.categoriesPixe.description: List of pixel categorical values for which to report counts.

StatisticsQueryParameters.histogramBins.name: histogram_bins
StatisticsQueryParameters.histogramBins.description:
Defines the number of equal-width bins in the given range (10, by default).

If bins is a sequence (comma `,` delimited values), it defines a monotonically
increasing array of bin edges, including the rightmost edge, allowing for
non-uniform bin widths.

link: https://numpy.org/doc/stable/reference/generated/numpy.histogram.html

StatisticsQueryParameters.histogramRange.name: histogram_range
StatisticsQueryParameters.histogramRange.description:
Comma `,` delimited range of the bins.

The lower and upper range of the bins. If not provided, range is simply
(a.min(), a.max()).

Values outside the range are ignored. The first element of the range must be
less than or equal to the second.
range affects the automatic bin computation as well.

link: https://numpy.org/doc/stable/reference/generated/numpy.histogram.html

StatisticsQueryParameters.maxSize.name: max_size
StatisticsQueryParameters.maxSize.description: Maximum dimension in pixels for the source data used to calculate statistics
